channel.title: desert on Cucumber Sandwiches And Tea
channel.description: Recent content in desert on Cucumber Sandwiches And Tea

item.title: Chocolate lava cake
item.description: I accidentally stumbled across this recipe the other day and had to try it: Chocolate Lava Cake. It tastes wonderful. I want to make it again, but I probably shouldn’t.

item.title: Congo Bars
item.description: Ingredients 150 g butter, softened 3 eggs 200 g brown sugar (1 cup) 1 packet vanilla sugar (about 3 tsp.) 350 g flour (3 cups) 2 1/2 tsp. baking powder 1/2 teaspoon salt 100 g chocolate Directions Chop the chocolate finely. Preheat the oven to 180 °C. Combine butter, vanilla sugar and brown sugar using a mixer until blended. Add eggs, one at a time to sugar mixture, mixing on low in between each addition.

item.title: Cup-O'-Ccino
item.description: Ingredients 120 g margarine< 100 g sugar 2 eggs (large) 180 g flour 2 tsp. baking powder 6 tbsp. espresso 150 g chocolate Directions Chop 50 g of the chocolate into small pieces. Place margarine and sugar in a large bowl. Mix until fluffy. Add the eggs one by one, beating the mixture until it is smooth each time. Preheat the oven to 180° C. Mix the flour and baking powder and stir into the bowl.

item.title: Kumquat Muffins
item.description: I usually make muffins using butter milk. I did not have any and wanted to make muffins so I tried using cream cheese instead. It worked very well. I think one could easily replace the kumquats with any other type of fruit or leave them out altogether. Ingredients 1/2 cup margarine 1/2 cup sugar 3 eggs 1 tsp vanilla sugar 2 cups flour 1 tsp baking powder 100 g cream cheese 150 g kumquat Directions Chop the kumquats including peel, I used a food processor to do this.

item.title: Mini Chocolate Cheesecake
item.description: Ingredients 9 sheets of puff pastry 100 g chocolate (I used dark chocolate) 1 egg 70 g sugar 200 g cream cheese 1 tbsp. sour cream 1 tsp. lemon juice Directions Preheat the oven to 180°C. Butter 9 cupcake forms. Melt the chocolate and set aside. Cut each sheet of puff pastry into three pieces, roll them a little thinner and place them in the cupcake form. Beat the egg and the sugar until white.
